org.jetel.component

Class MysqlDataWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
        • org.jetel.component.BulkLoader
          • org.jetel.component.MysqlDataWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener

    public class MysqlDataWriter
extends BulkLoader

    Mysql data writer

    Comment:

    Component:

    Name:

    		 Mysql data writer

    Category:

    Description:

    		 This component loads data to mysql database using the mysql utility. It is faster then DBOutputTable. Load formats data pages directly, while avoiding most of the overhead of individual row processing that inserts incur.
    There is created mysql command (LOAD DATA INFILE) depending on input parameters. Data are read from given input file or from the input port and loaded to database.
    Any generated commands/files can be optionally logged to help diagnose problems.
    Before you use this component, make sure that mysql client is installed and configured on the machine where CloverETL runs and mysql command line tool available.

    Inputs:

    		 [0] - input records. It can be omitted - then fileURL has to be provided.

    Outputs:

    		 [0] - optionally one output port defined/connected - info about rejected records. Output metadata contains three fields with row number (integer), column name (string) and error message (string).

    XML attributes:
    type "MYSQL_DATA_WRITER"
    id component identification
    mysqlPath path to mysql utility
    database the name of the database to receive the data
    table table name, where data are loaded
    columnDelimiter
    optional    		 delimiter used for each column in data (default = '\t')
    Value of the delimiter mustn't be contained in data.
    fileURL
    optional    		 Path to data file to be loaded.
    Normally this file is a temporary storage for data to be passed to mysql utility. If fileURL is not specified, at Windows platform the file is created in Clover or OS temporary directory and deleted after load finishes. At Linux/Unix system named pipe is used instead of temporary file. If fileURL is specified, temporary file is created within given path and name and not deleted after being loaded. Next graph run overwrites it.
    There is one more meaning of this parameter. If input port is not specified, this file is used only for reading by mysql utility and must already contain data in format expected by load. The file is neither deleted nor overwritten.
    commandURL
    optional    		 Path to command file where LOAD DATA INFILE statement is stored.
    If commandURL is not specified, the command file is created in Clover temporary directory and deleted after load finishes.
    If commandURL is specified and this file doesn't exist, temporary command file is created within given path and name and not deleted after being loaded. Default command file is stored here.
    If commandURL is specified and this file exist, this file is used instead of command file created by Clover.
    host
    optional    		 Import data to the MySQL server on the given host. The default host is localhost.
    username
    optional    		 The MySQL username to use when connecting to the server.
    password
    optional    		 The password to use when connecting to the server.
    lockTable A flag specifying whether to lock the table in order to ensure exclusive access and possibly faster loading.
    ignoreRows Ignore the first N lines of the data file.
    parameters
    optional    		 All possible additional parameters which can be passed on to mysql utility or to LOAD DATA INFILE statement.
    Parameters, in form key=value (or key - interpreted as key=true, if possible value are only "true" or "false") has to be separated by :;| {colon, semicolon, pipe}. If in parameter value occurs one of :;|, value has to be double quoted.
    Load parameters
    Parameters for mysql utility
    skipAutoRehash Disable automatic rehashing. Disables table and column name completion. That causes mysql to start faster.
    If skipAutoRehash attribute isn't defined, default value is true.
    characterSetsDir The directory where character sets are installed. See The Character Set Used for Data and Sorting.
    compress Compress all information sent between the client and the server if both support compression.
    defaultCharacterSet Use defaultCharacterSet as the default character set. See The Character Set Used for Data and Sorting.
    force Continue even if an SQL error occurs.
    noBeep Do not beep when errors occur.
    port The TCP/IP port number to use for the connection.
    protocol The connection protocol to use. One of {TCP|SOCKET|PIPE|MEMORY}.
    reconnect If the connection to the server is lost, automatically try to reconnect. A single reconnect attempt is made each time the connection is lost.
    secureAuth Do not send passwords to the server in old (pre-4.1.1) format. This prevents connections except for servers that use the newer password format.
    showWarnings Cause warnings to be shown after each statement if there are any. If showWarnings attribute isn't defined, default value is true.
    If any output port is connected, this parameter must be used.
    silent Silent mode. Produce output only when errors occur.
    socket For connections to localhost, the Unix socket file to use, or, on Windows, the name of the named pipe to use.
    ssl Options that begin with ssl attribute specify whether to connect to the server via SSL and indicate where to find SSL keys and certificates. See SSL Command Options.
    Parameters for LOAD DATA INFILE statement
    uniqueChecks Used to set the unique_checks session variable before the LOAD DATA INFILE statement is executed. If set to 0 (default is 1), it may speed up the execution.
    foreignKeyChecks Used to set foreign_key_checks session variable before the LOAD DATA INFILE statement is executed. If set to 0 (default is 1), it may speed up the execution.
    sqlLogBin Used to set the sql_log_bin session variable before the LOAD DATA INFILE statement is executed. If set to 0 (default is 1), it may speed up the execution.
    local Read input files locally from the client host.
    If local attribute isn't defined, default value is true.
    lowPriority If you use lowPriority, execution of the LOAD DATA statement is delayed until no other clients are reading from the table. This affects only storage engines that use only table-level locking (MyISAM, MEMORY, MERGE).
    concurrent If you specify concurrent with a MyISAM table that satisfies the condition for concurrent inserts (that is, it contains no free blocks in the middle), other threads can retrieve data from the table while LOAD DATA is executing. Using this option affects the performance of LOAD DATA a bit, even if no other thread is using the table at the same time.
    ignore See the description for the replace attribute.
    replace The replace and ignore parameter control handling of input rows that duplicate existing rows on unique key values. If you specify replace parameter, input rows replace existing rows. In other words, rows that have the same value for a primary key or unique index as an existing row. See REPLACE Syntax.
    If you specify ignore parameter, input rows that duplicate an existing row on a unique key value are skipped. If you do not specify either option, the behavior depends on whether the local parameter is specified. Without local, an error occurs when a duplicate key value is found, and the rest of the text file is ignored. With local, the default behavior is the same as if ignore is specified; this is because the server has no way to stop transmission of the file in the middle of the operation.
    fieldsEnclosedBy It is used for enclosing each filed in data by char.
    When data is read from input port this attribute is ignored.
    fieldsIsOptionallyEnclosed It decide if fieldsEnclosedBy is used for each columns or not.
    It can be used only with fieldsEnclosedBy attribute.
    When data is read from input port this attribute is ignored.
    fieldsEscapedBy It is used form escaping fields by char.
    When data is read from input port this attribute is ignored.
    linesStartingBy If all the lines you want to read in have a common prefix that you want to ignore, you can use linesStartingBy to skip over the prefix, and anything before it. If a line does not include the prefix, the entire line is skipped.
    recordDelimiter Specifies the record delimiter. (default = '\n' (newline character)).
    columns This option takes a comma-separated list of column names as its value. The order of the column names indicates how to match data file columns with table columns.

    Example:

    Reading data from input port: 
     <Node
  mysqlPath="mysql"
  database="testdb"
  table="test"
  id="MYSQL_DATA_WRITER1"
  type="MYSQL_DATA_WRITER"
  />
    Reading data from flat file: 
     <Node
  mysqlPath="mysql"
  database="testdb" 
  table="test"
  columnDelimiter="," 
  fileURL="${WORKSPACE}/data/delimited/mysqlFlat.dat" 
  parameters="fieldsEnclosedBy=*|fieldsIsOptionallyEnclosed"
  id="MYSQL_DATA_WRITER0"
  type="MYSQL_DATA_WRITER"/>
  />
    Since:
    24.9.2007
    See Also:
    TransformationGraph, Node, Edge
